name: N'Joy Pothos
climate: Thrives in a warm and humid environment similar to tropical regions.
Cannot tolerate cold climates and should be kept away from drafts.
Prefers temperatures between 65-85°F (18-29°C) for optimal growth.
Does well in indoor conditions with relatively stable temperatures.
sunlight: Requires bright, indirect sunlight for vibrant foliage color.
Can tolerate some low light conditions but may grow slower.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves, causing them to turn yellow.
It's best to place the plant near an east or north-facing window.
watering: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, a common issue with pothos.
Reduce watering frequency during the colder winter months.
Ensure proper drainage to allow excess water to escape easily.
soil: Prefers a well-draining potting mix to prevent waterlogging.
A combination of peat moss, perlite, and vermiculite works well.
Avoid soil that retains too much moisture, hindering root health.
Repot every 1-2 years to refresh soil and check root growth.
toxic: Toxic to pets such as cats and dogs if ingested.
Can cause oral irritation, drooling, and vomiting upon consumption.
extra_care_tip: Wipe leaves with a damp cloth occasionally to remove dust.
Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage bushier growth.
